heading: webtv president resigns
subheading: the co-founder of microsoft's webtv unit steps down as president to pursue other interests.
author: reuters
text: webtv networks said tuesday that president and co-founder steve perlman is leaving the landmark company, a unit of microsoft, and being replaced by bruce leak. webtv was one of the first companies to make and sell tv set-top boxes, giving viewers access to the internet on television screens. it was subsequently bought by microsoft (msft), and currently has 800,000 subscribers.perlman will leave the company at the end of the month, take the summer off and then explore "new entrepreneurial endeavors," the company said in a statement.he will continue to be a member of webtv networks' advisory board.leak, who co-founded the webtv network with perlman and phil goldman, will take on perlman's role and become a member of microsoft's executive staff.leak, formerly the general manager of webtv networks' service division, has served as chief operating officer for the company. before webtv, he held management and development positions at videogame company rocket science games and general magic.copyright
